jobDescription: The Role: As a Senior Data Analyst on the Finished Vehicle logistics team, you will be responsible for providing analytics support to the Outbound logistics team. Responsibilities:Work closely with operations team members to define and develop key performance indicators, measuring operational performance and outcomes.Analyze key drivers of logistics performance and identify prioritized actions for reducing vehicle dwell time, optimizing lane transit time, and minimizing vehicle re-routings and exceptions.Establish systematic ways to gather data and reinforce or modify existing assumptions, for example by making the routing guide a data-driven product.Experience or capacity to build models, query data across multiple SQL databases, and conduct rigorous quantitative analysis.Work closely with third party logistics providers to quantify milestones and goals, and develop reporting triggers based on partner performance.Determine optimal benchmarks to enable operations decision-making: for example, when to send low-density shipments.Conduct network capacity analysis and resiliency studies: which failure points are more likely, and which portions of the network are robust.Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in computer science, supply chain, data science, or mathematics; or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional ability.5+ years' experience working with ERP systems design and launch, business analytics, or robust quantitative analysis.Exceptional analytical skills with regards to logistics analysis, data manipulation, and the ability to create information from data.Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate with technical team members is essential.Experience or capacity to build data models, query data sources, clean data, and synthesize analysis in clear language, accessible to both technical and non-technical audiences.Ability to define problems, collect relevant data, extract meaning from data, and draw logical and coherent conclusions.
